meanings.definition: A male demon believed to have sexual intercourse with sleeping women.
meanings.sent1: The ancient tale spoke of an incubus haunting the dreams of maidens.
meanings.sent2: The villagers feared the incubus that lurked in the shadows of the night.
meanings.sent3: The idea of an incubus visiting in the night made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of commitment was like an incubus, suffocating her happiness.
meanings.sent5: The image of the incubus was etched in her mind, a haunting presence.

meanings.definition: A cause of distress or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: The upcoming exam was an incubus on his mind, causing sleepless nights.
meanings.sent2: The constant noise outside became an incubus, disrupting her concentration.
meanings.sent3: The thought of losing her favorite toy was an incubus she couldn't shake off.
meanings.sent4: The looming deadline felt like an incubus, weighing heavily on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds were an incubus, foretelling a storm of emotions.

meanings.sent1: The vivid dream turned into an incubus, haunting her waking hours.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie left her with an incubus that lingered in her thoughts.
meanings.sent3: The silly prank became an incubus, making her jump at every sound.
meanings.sent4: The embarrassing moment replayed in her mind like an incubus, refusing to fade.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the night was an incubus, filling her with dread.
